title: Zero Depreciation Vehicle Insurance Cover And The Important Points To Note About It (Rahul Roa)
text: By Rahul Roa Oct 15, 2015 Whenever the former makes a claim for his insured vehicle in the event of an accident, he is likely to be reimbursed after deduction of a particular amount, related to depreciation of his vehicle, which has to be borne out of his own expenses. On the other hand, the latter insurer will have the ability to get full coverage in the event of car damage as his insurance policy promises zero depreciation car insurance. It is therefore a very important factor when choosing the insurance policy and a prudent decision in the insurance policy purchase or renewal process.Some Factors That Apply To Zero Depreciation Car InsuranceSince it is the insurance company that has to bear the entire cost of the vehicle damage in case of zero depreciation vehicle insurance, there are certain limitations imposed by car insurance providers which must be noted by the buyer of the insurance policy to make sure they are satisfied with these limitations:* Vehicle insurance policies that come with zero depreciation car insurance are much costlier than ordinary insurance policies that pay the claim amount only partially in the event of car or vehicle damage. Hence the insurer must be aware that he is likely to go for a costlier car insurance policy with a higher deductible amount in case of zero depreciation car insurance.* As another limitation imposed by car insurance companies, the number of claims that can be made for vehicle damage are limited since the whole cost is shouldered by the insurance company alone.* Generally, the car insurance companies are more likely to provide zero depreciation car insurance only for new vehicles. This is advantageous to both the buyer of the insurance cover as well as the insurance policy provider. The company might have to shell out exorbitant amounts for the damage repair of old vehicles in the case of a zero depreciation car insurance and the customer might also not be willing to spend a huge premium for an old vehicle.Is Zero Decrease Car Insurance Right For You?The decision of buying an insurance policy that includes zero depreciation car insurance is dependent on not just the age of the vehicle, but also the experience of the person who will be driving it. Keeping these factors in mind, it would not be wise to go in for a nil depreciation car insurance for an old vehicle even if is available through certain service providers, since it would not be prudent to shell out huge deductibles every month for a car that is heavily used. On the other hand, when it comes to the experience of the driver, it is recommended for both new as well as experienced drivers who are owners of new cars since the possibility of an accident is applicable in both cases. About the Author I work for a major motor manufacturing company in India and I am a car enthusiast as well. I am passionate about cars and keep myself updated about, well, just about everything. My views are my own. I would like to know more about cars and car insurance. Hence, I keep coming here to read and post! Rating:
